current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To prohibit bonuses to senior-level IRS executives until all Congressional requests for documents,
			 including electronic communications, related to the investigation of IRS
			 targeting of taxpayers are complete.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Holding the IRS Leadership Accountable Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Holding the IRS Leadership Accountable Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall not provide any performance award (including bonuses,
			 step increases, and leave time) to senior-level executives of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Treasury Inspector General for Tax
			 Administration

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
has provided
			 all documents, including all electronic communications, requested by the
			 relevant congressional committees in due course of their investigation
			 into the targeting of certain taxpayers who applied for designation as an
			 organization described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 501(c)(4) of the Internal Revenue Code
			 of 1986

header.#text: Prohibition on bonuses until IRS complies with Congressional document requests

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2517 IS: Holding the IRS Leadership Accountable Act
